member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartAreaLayoutMode
member.summary: Specifies the positioning behavior of multiple chart areas on a single chart image.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartAreaLayoutMode.VerticalPriority
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas layout will be based on axis relationships where x axes will be matched before chart areas are added based on y axis relationships. ChartAreaLayoutRules.EnforceOppositeAxisAlignment affects this setting.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartAreaLayoutMode.HorizontalPriority
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas layout will be based on axis relationships where y axes will be matched before chart areas are added based on x axis relationships. ChartAreaLayoutRules.EnforceOppositeAxisAlignment affects this setting.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartAreaLayoutMode.VerticalSmart
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out vertically in a single column and arranged based on x axis relationships.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartAreaLayoutMode.HorizontalSmart
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out horizontally in a single row and arranged based on x axis relationships.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartAreaLayoutMode.Vertical
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out vertically in a single column in the order they were added.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartAreaLayoutMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out horizontally in a single row in the order they were added.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartAreaLayoutMode.Custom
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out in a grid matrix based on ChartArea.GridPosition.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType
member.summary: Represents the chart type of a chart.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Combo
member.summary: The combo chart supports virtually every feature. This chart is capable of being every chart you want it to be based on settings of other objects like series and axes. The x axis is a label axis and the y axis is a value axis. Element values used YValue, YValueStart, YDateTime, YDateTimeStart, Complete

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.ComboSideBySide
member.summary: Each series is drawn side by side. This chart doesn't support stacked axis scales and unclustered columns. The x axis is a label axis and the y axis is a value axis. Element values used YValue, YValueStart, YDateTime, YDateTimeStart, Complete

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.ComboHorizontal
member.summary: This chart supports the bar and cylinder series types. The y axis is a label axis and the x axis is a value axis. Element values used YValue, YValueStart, YDateTime, YDateTimeStart, Complete

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Pie
member.summary: The pie chart draws a single pie where each slice represents a series. Most applications would use Pies rather than Pie Element values used YValue

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Pies
member.summary: Multiple pies where each pie is a series and each slice is an element (suitable for most applications). Pies may also be drawn as donuts. Most applications would use Pies rather than Pie. Pies does not support Series.Palette. Element values used YValue

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Donut
member.summary: See Pie.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Donuts
member.summary: See Pies.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Radar
member.summary: Draws a single radar. The time scale is not supported by the radar graph. Element values used YValue

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Radars
member.summary: Draws multiple radars where each radar is a series. The time scale is not supported by radar graph. Element values used YValue

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Scatter
member.summary: Draws scattered data. Markers, lines, and splines are supported. Element values used YValue, YDateTime, XValue, XDateTime

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Bubble
member.summary: Draws scattered data. Markers, lines, and splines are supported. Data Used: YValue, YDateTime, XValue, XDateTime

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Financial
member.summary: Only 3 axes exist for this chart, price, volume and x axis. No more axes can be bound to series but you can calculate as many axes as you would like. HLC Charts can be achieved by providing a high, low, and close but leaving open equal double.NaN. Element values used Open, High, Low, Close, Volume

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Gantt
member.summary: See ComboHorizontal.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Gauges
member.summary: Draws a gauge for each series. Each element represents a needle. Element values used YValue

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Map
member.summary: Draws a map from a shapefile or ecw image.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.MultipleGrouped
member.summary: Draws multiple type series that are laid out on the chart similar to Pie.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.Multiple
member.summary: Draws multiple type series that are laid out on the chart similar to gauges or radars.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartType.PiesNested
member.summary: Draws pies that are nested or stacked.

member.summary: Specifies the position of the legend box.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LegendBoxPosition.Top
member.summary: The legend box is rendered at the top right side of the graph.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LegendBoxPosition.Middle
member.summary: The legend box is rendered at the middle right side of the graph.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LegendBoxPosition.Bottom
member.summary: The legend box is rendered at the bottom right side of the graph.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LegendBoxPosition.BottomMiddle
member.summary: The legend box is rendered at the bottom middle side of the graph.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LegendBoxPosition.None
member.summary: The legend box is now visible.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LegendEntryHeaderMode
member.summary: Specifies a header mode for element entries.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LegendEntryHeaderMode.None
member.summary: No effect.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LegendEntryHeaderMode.RepeatOnEachColumn
member.summary: Forces the LegendEntry to be repeated at the top of each column in multi-column legend boxes.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LegendEntryHeaderMode.StartNewColumn
member.summary: Causes the LegendEntry to start a new column.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LimitMode
member.summary: Controls the type of limitation in Limit or SplitByLimit properties.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LimitMode.Top
member.summary: Keep only top Limit values.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LimitMode.Bottom
member.summary: Keep only bottom Limit values.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LimitMode.ExcludeTop
member.summary: Remove top Limit values.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.LimitMode.ExcludeBottom
member.summary: Remove Bottom Limit values.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.PieLabelMode
member.summary: Specifies pie label behavior.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.PieLabelMode.Inside
member.summary: Labels must be inside the pie, if they dont fit they will not be visible.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.PieLabelMode.Outside
member.summary: Labels are drawn outside the pie with a line pointing to the slice it represents.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.PieLabelMode.Automatic
member.summary: If labels fit inside a slice they are drawn there otherwise they are drawn outside with a line pointing to the slice it represents.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.RadarLabelMode
member.summary: Specifies how tick labels behave on a radar graph.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.RadarLabelMode.None
member.summary: The labels are not visible.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.RadarLabelMode.Normal
member.summary: The labels are drawn horizontally next to the tick mark.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.RadarLabelMode.Angled
member.summary: The labels are angled based on the tick mark angle.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.RadarLabelMode.Inside
member.summary: The label is on the right side of the tick mark and angled to touch the top of the grid. The label will be within the radar grid.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.RadarLabelMode.Outside
member.summary: The label is on the right side of the tick mark and angled to lie on top of the grid. The label will be outside the radar grid.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.RadarMode
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the x axis on a circular graph such as radar.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.RadarMode.Spider
member.summary: The x axis tick marks are connected by straight lines resembling a spider web.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.RadarMode.Polar
member.summary: The x axis ticks marks are connected by arcs completing a circle around the chart. Connected data points such as lines will have data points interpolated around the arc.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Scale
member.summary: Indicates the scale of an axis.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Scale.Normal
member.summary: The normal scale will always show 0 on the chart.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Scale.Range
member.summary: The axis will start and end shortly outside the range of element values.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Scale.Logarithmic
member.summary: Logarithmic axis scale.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Scale.Time
member.summary: Time axis scale.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Scale.Stacked
member.summary: Similar to Normal but elements are stacked on top of each other.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Scale.FullStacked
member.summary: Elements are stacked and each stack is equal to 100.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Scale.LogarithmicStacked
member.summary: Similar to Logarithmic but elements are stacked on top of each other.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ScaleBreakStyle
member.summary: Specifies how a scale break is drawn on a chart.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ScaleBreakStyle.None
member.summary: The scale break is not accentuated in any way.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ScaleBreakStyle.ZigZag
member.summary: A gap with a zig zag is drawn at the scale break position.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ScaleBreakStyle.Gap
member.summary: A gap is drawn at the scale break position.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ScaleBreakStyle.Line
member.summary: A line is drawn at the scale break position.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType
member.summary: Specifies how a series will be shown on the chart.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.Marker
member.summary: Draws elements as element markers.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.Line
member.summary: Draws the series as a line.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.Spline
member.summary: Draws the series as a spline.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.AreaLine
member.summary: Draws the series as an area line.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.Column
member.summary: Draws the series as a bar.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.Cylinder
member.summary: Draws the series as a cylinder.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.Bar
member.summary: See Column.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.Bubble
member.summary: Draws the series elements as bubbles.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.AreaSpline
member.summary: Draws the series as an area spline.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.Pyramid
member.summary: Draws the series as a four point pyramid.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.Cone
member.summary: Draws the series as a cone.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.BubbleShape
member.summary: Draws the series as a shape, based on the element's ShapeType property.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SeriesType.BarSegmented
member.summary: Draws the series as a segmented bar.

member.summary: Draws the high price as a line.

member.summary: Draws the low price as a line.

member.summary: Draws the series as a pyramid.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SubValueType
member.summary: Specifies the how a sub value is drawn.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SubValueType.ErrorBar
member.summary: Draws a traditional error bar. The width of the cap line is determined by SubValue.Line.Length. If not specified it is dynamically determined based on the element size.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SubValueType.Marker
member.summary: Draws a marker at the value position of the SubValue. Two markers are drawn then the SubValue represents a range.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SubValueType.Line
member.summary: Same as the error bar except only the cap lines are drawn.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SynchronizeScaleMode
member.summary: Specifies an axis scale synchronization mode between two or more axes.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SynchronizeScaleMode.Origin
member.summary: Synchronizes axes to match the axis origins. The origin is the position on a numeric axis where the value is zero (0). This mode does not apply to time axes.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SynchronizeScaleMode.Full
member.summary: Synchronizes the complete axis scale (high, and low).

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SynchronizeScaleMode.High
member.summary: Synchronizes the high range values of multiple axes.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.SynchronizeScaleMode.Low
member.summary: Synchronizes the low range values of multiple axes.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TickLabelMode
member.summary: Specifies how tick labels are laid out.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TickLabelMode.Automatic
member.summary: Specifies that the best mode is automatically determined.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TickLabelMode.Angled
member.summary: Specifies that labels are angled. Only applies to x axes.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TickLabelMode.Normal
member.summary: Specifies that labels are drawn horizontally on a single line. If labels will overlap with this setting, they will automatically switch to angled.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TickLabelMode.Wrapped
member.summary: Specifies that labels are drawn wrapping horizontally. If labels will overlap with this setting, they will automatically switch to angled.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeInterval
member.summary: Specifies a time interval.

member.summary: Specifies minutes.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeInterval.Hours
member.summary: Specifies hours.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeInterval.Days
member.summary: Specifies days.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeInterval.Weeks
member.summary: Specifies weeks.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeInterval.Months
member.summary: Specifies months.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeInterval.Quarters
member.summary: Specifies quarters (3 months).

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeInterval.Years
member.summary: Specifies years.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeInterval.Hour
member.summary: Specifies hour by minute.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeScaleLabelMode
member.summary: Specifies the single value time label automation mode.
member.remarks: This feature automates choosing different format strings and axis ticks for particular instances in time. These time instance attributes can be modified through the Axis.TimeLabelAutomationMode property. (Tutorial) See: Getting Started / General Tutorials / Axis Tutorials / Axis Ticks / Axis Time Label Automation

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeScaleLabelMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies no time label automation. Only the Axis.DefaultTick and Axis.FormatString will be used.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeScaleLabelMode.Hidden
member.summary: Specifies hidden time label mode. Single value time labels will not be shown.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeScaleLabelMode.Dynamic
member.summary: Specifies time instance specific label automation mode. Axis ticks will use a format string and axis tick relevant to the instance in time they represent.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeScaleLabelMode.Smart
member.summary: Specifies smart time label automation. Similar to specific except the first tick will indicate the instance in time and take it's default value from the axis default tick.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeScaleLabelRangeMode
member.summary: Specifies the range value time label automation mode.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeScaleLabelRangeMode.Default
member.summary: Range time ticks will not be generated unless the time intervals are specified in TimeScaleLabelInfo.RangeIntervals.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.TimeScaleLabelRangeMode.Dynamic
member.summary: Range time ticks are generated based on dynamically determined intervals. If time intervals are specified in TimeScaleLabelInfo.RangeIntervals this mode will behave like Default mode.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Annotation
member.summary: Encapsulates a dotnetCHARTING.Box object with a position, data source, and hot spot functionality.
member.remarks: Annotations can either be instantiated for an Element or added to the Chart.Annotation collection. When attached to an element, the annotation will follow the element's position (unless specified) and have a spike indicating which element it's referring to. When an annotation does not have a size or any text specified and it's Background has an image, the size is will become that of the background's image.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis
member.summary: Represents an axis drawn on a ChartArea.
member.remarks: The axis object is a powerful class that does the following. Defines objects used to draw the axis and fill sections of a ChartArea such as grid lines. Facilitates tick label text formatting and numerous manipulation mechanisms. Defines data element layout and order. Defines an axis dotnetCHARTING.Scale, range, and tick frequency. Calculates copies of itself that can perform unit conversions between over one thousand defined units, mark time ranges with a specified TimeInterval, and manipulate each tick label with a specified custom method. Axes can behave in 3 different modes. Mode Description Value Axis The value axis dynamically displays a numeric or DateTime range. Properties such as Scale, Interval, TimeInterval and others that relate to ranges apply to this type of axis. Using ChartType.Combo, the y axis is a value axis, with ChartType.Horizontal the x axis is. Label Axis The label axis does not display a range of values but rather the names of elements or series. Using ChartType.Combo, the x axis is a label axis and with ChartType.Horizontal the y axis is. Using the DataEngine with DataEngine.DateGrouping generates elements with a numeric value in Element.YValue and a DateTime value in Element.XDateTime. Because the Combo chart's x axis is a label axis the date time value cannot be shown. To remedy this, the DataEngine also populates each element's Name property with a string representation of the DateTime value. This allows the x axis to show date values but it does not allow the use of advanced options such as setting the TimeInterval for those dates. To expose this functionality ChartType.Scatter must be used because the x axis for that chart type acts as a value axis. Calculated Axis A calculated or shadow axis is created by using of the Axis.Calculate methods and must be added to the Chart.AxisCollection collection. It is drawn by the original axis and represents the same range but displays it in a different way.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.CenterTickMarks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether axis ticks are centered above tick labels or drawn between each label.
member.remarks: When false, Axis.DefaultTick.Line properties are used for all tick lines.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.ClearValues
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether tick labels are cleared before LabelOverrides are applied.
member.remarks: Only the tick labels that are not overridden are cleared.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.ClusterColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether columns and cylinders are drawn side by side or front to back.
member.remarks: (Applies to label axes) When true, columns and cylinders are drawn side by side.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.CombinedElementsCalculation
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calculation used when multiple elements on a quantitative x axis are located at the same x position. If the elements are columns they will be combined into a single element using this calculation, otherwise, the original elements are plotted.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.CultureName
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture name used for number and date formatting in conjunction with FormatString.
member.remarks: The culture name is applied to tick values and data charted on this axis. See the CultureInfo class for possible names of a culture. (This property applies to value axes)

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.DefaultMinorTick
member.summary: Gets or sets the default dotnetCHARTING.AxisTick used for all generated minor axis ticks.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.DefaultTick
member.summary: Gets or sets an AxisTick that acts as a vehicle for property settings that will propagate to all other axis ticks on this axis.
member.remarks: The property settings of this object will not overwrite properties explicitly set for any given AxisTick.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.ExtraTicks
member.summary: A collection of AxisTick objects added to the axis.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.FormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string used by this axis.
member.remarks: Tick labels and labels of elements bound to this axis will be formatted with this format string. (This property applies to value axes)

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.GaugeLabelMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the GaugeLabelMode for axis ticks drawn on this axis when using gauges.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.GaugeNeedleType
member.summary: Gets or sets the GaugeNeedleType used with this axis on gauges.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.GenerateElementTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an AxisTick object is generated for each element's position on this axis.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.GridLine
member.summary: Gets or sets this axis' grid dotnetCHARTING.Line. This property is the equivalent of using the Axis.DefaultTick.GridLine property.
member.remarks: Grid lines are drawn for each tick mark on an axis to the other side of a ChartArea. To disable grid lines set GridLine.Color = Color.Empty or Axis.ShowGrid = false.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric tick label interval for this axis.
member.remarks: Tick labels will increment by this value starting at Axis.Minimum and ending at Axis.Maximum if specified. If not set, the interval is automatically determined based on the data range. (Applies to quantitative axes with numeric scales)

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.InvertScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the axis scale is inverted.
member.remarks: When true the axis ticks will be reversed.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis label.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.LabelMarker
member.summary: Gets or sets an ElementMarker object used on gauge charts in place of the axis' label.
member.remarks: The marker will be positioned between the needle base and the center of the gauge axis.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.LabelOverrides
member.summary: A collection of LabelOverride objects.
member.remarks: LabelOverrides defines a string find and replace pair used to manipulate tick labels.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.LabelRotate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether the axis label of this y axis is facing the tick labels or is facing away.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Line
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis dotnetCHARTING.Line.
member.remarks: When the origin or 'point of zero' is visible on the axis, this line is drawn twice and away from the origin in order for line caps to appear correctly (Line.StartCap, Line.EndCap).

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.LogarithmicBase
member.summary: Gets or sets the logarithmic base of logarithmic axis scales. Used only in conjunction with Logarithmic Scales.
member.remarks: This property is used in conjunction with enumeration members Scale.Logarithmic and Scale.LogarithmicStacked.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Markers
member.summary: A collection of AxisMarkers used to highlight sections of this axis.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper bounds of this numeric axis' range.
member.remarks: Applies to value axes. When not specified, this value is set relative to the maximum range of the plotted data.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower bounds of this numeric axis' range.
member.remarks: Applies to value axes. When not specified, this value defaults to 0. When the range axis scale is used, it will be set relative to the minimum range of the plotted data.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.MinimumInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric minimum interval value.
member.remarks: This allows you to prevent the axis scales from using intervals that are smaller than a single unit of your data. For example a chart showing votes where the maximum value is three may show intervals at .5, which cant represent any data for your chart. In this case setting this value to 1 will represent the chart data better.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.MinorInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a numeric value that determines the interval of minor axis ticks.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.MinorTicksPerInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minor axis ticks generated between major axis ticks.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.MinorTimeIntervalAdvanced
member.summary: Gets or sets a TimeIntervalAdvanced object that determines the interval of minor axis ticks.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this axis.
member.remarks: If Axis.Label.Text is not specified this value will be used. The name is also used to identify the axis with element or series tokens.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.NumberPercision
member.summary: See NumberPrecision

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.NumberPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of decimal digits of this axis' format.
member.remarks: If not specified, this value will be determined automatically. (Applies to value axes)

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of this axis.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.OrientationAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets an angle measured in degrees clockwise from the y-axis specifying the direction a gauge axis is oriented.
member.remarks: When RangeAngle is set, the orientation is the point the middle of the axis is facing. When SweepAngle is set, the orientation is the starting angle of the sweep.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.OverlappingCircularLabelSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets a text label separator used when two axis ticks on a radar's x axis overlap.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Percent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether this axis displays percent values.
member.remarks: When true, a percent sign sign will be added to the end of tick labels and the Maximum will snap to 100 percent if the plotted data's range falls between 50 and 100. (Applies to value axes not using Scale.Time)

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis positions when 2 or more axes are drawn on the same side of a ChartArea.
member.remarks: Lower values will be drawn closer to the front. This will also affect the order of series bound the the axes.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.RadarMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the RadarMode of this axis. Applies when this object is the x axis of a radar chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.RangeAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets an angle measured in degrees that is centered at the orientation angle.
member.remarks: Example: If the orientation angle is 100 and the range angle is 100, the axis will begin at 50 degrees and end at 150 degrees.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.ReverseSeries
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the positions of series bound to this axis are reversed.
member.remarks: (Applies to label axes)

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.ReverseSeriesPositions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the positions of series bound to this axis are reversed without reversing legend positions.
member.remarks: Applies to label axes.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.ReverseStack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the order of stacked elements is reversed.
member.remarks: Applies to value axes using a stacked axis Scale.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale of this axis.
member.remarks: Applies to value axes.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.ScaleBreakStyle

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.ScaleRange

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.ShowGrid

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.SmartMinorTicks

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.StaticColumnWidth

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.SweepAngle

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.SynchronizeScale

member.remarks: When the axis is a label axis, the tick label's text can be populated with tokens which represent information about the plotted data.

member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of axis tick labels when they are angled. Setting this property will not automatically angle tick labels.
member.remarks: To force tick label angles, set Axis.TickLabelMode = Axis.TickLabelMode.Angled.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.TickLabelPadding

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.TickLabelSeparatorLine
member.summary: Gets or sets the a tick label separator. The separator is automatically used when labels are wrapped. To disable or enable, set the this line's color to Color.Transparent or a valid color respectively.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.TickLine

member.remarks: Setting TickLine.Length will specify the tick line's length.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.TickNumberMaximum

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.TimeInterval

member.remarks: (Applies to quantitative axes using Scale.Time)

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Axis.TimeIntervalAdvanced

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.AxisMarker
member.summary: Defines styles and positions used to mark a specified section or point on an axis.
member.remarks: Each marker displayed on the chart will also have a dotnetCHARTING.LegendEntry in the LegendBox. There are two ways to use AxisMarkers. Attach to axis An AxisMarker can be added to the Markers collection of any axis. In this case, a numeric, time, or text: value or range must be specified. When Value is specified, ValueLow and ValueHigh are both set to this value. When ValueLow and ValueHigh are equivalent, this AxisMarker is represented by the Line object, otherwise, Background fills the range between ValueLow and ValueHigh. Attach to element An AxisMarker is instantiated and passed to the AxisMarker property of any element. In such a case, the axis marker is drawn on the Axis where the element's name is displayed. See sample 'AxisMarkerAdvanced.aspx' in the download.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.AxisTick
member.summary: Encapsulates an axis tick that includes Label or ElementMarker, TickLine, and GridLine styling objects.
member.remarks: Appearance AxisTick objects can appear in three different ways. Normal axis tick with a label. AxisTick where the label is replaced with the AxisTick.Marker object (Icon or Image). Range AxisTick in which case the tick has a low and high value. Uses AxisTick objects can also be used in different ways. As an additional axis tick. To override a tick on an axis. To override multiple ticks on an axis.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.CalendarPattern
member.summary: Specifies a calendar pattern such as weekends in a week.
member.remarks: The pattern is represented by an array of boolean values. CalendarPattern.PatternFromString can be used to quickly create patterns using simple strings. A week pattern would look like this: "0000000". A zero for each day of the week. To indicate weekends the pattern will be "1000001". The time units must also be specified. Each one or zero represents a day: myCalendarPattern.PatternUnit = TimeInterval.Day The entire pattern represents a week: myCalendarPattern.CalendarUnit = TimeInterval.Week The above calendar pattern will flag each saturday and sunday in a given, time span.

member.remarks: If the pattern is "0011", after this operation it will become "1100".

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.BubbleCenterStack
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to control bubble center stack.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.BubbleStackShadeAsOne
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value to control bubble stack shade.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.CacheDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minutes an image is cached and displayed on a page before a new one is generated.
member.remarks: When set, a given chart image will be generated on the first hit and on all subsequent hits within the cache duration period the same image will be returned with no rendering work by the chart control.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.CalculateEmptyElement
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the values of empty elements are percieved as 0 or omitted in calculations performed with the Chart.SeriesCollection.Add(Calculation calc) shortcut.
member.remarks: If this property is set to false, in all calculations (average,min,median,mode etc.) only the applicable elements are counted. If set to true, such elements are given 0 values and included in the calculation. This case occurs when you have multiple series and are calculating derived series from them. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.ChartArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the main ChartArea of the image.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.CleanupMinimumAge
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of minutes images are stored in the TempDirectory before they are deleted.
member.remarks: When .netCHARTING renders a chart a temporary file is created in the directory set by the TempDirectory property. The CleanupMinimumAge ensures that only files older than this age, in minutes, will be deleted.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.CleanupPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minutes images are stored in the TempDirectory folder before they are deleted.
member.remarks: When .netCHARTING renders a chart a temporary file is created in the directory set by the TempDirectory property. The CleanUpPeriod property determines how frequently (in minutes) this directory is cleaned by deleting old temporary files. The default is 15 minutes and the property can be set to 0 in order to disable the cleanup in which case temp files are not automatically deleted. Any files that start with 'dnc-' will be deleted in the temp directory.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.ClipGauges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which determines if gauges should be clipped (cut) to display only the active area.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.CorrectionWarnings
member.summary: See Debug
member.remarks: When data is corrected for example the selected axis.scale is not appropriate for the data included in the chart this property will be populated with a descriptive message.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DatabaseCultureName
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture name used when StartDate and EndDate insert to the sql statement. This property only necessary to set if the web server and database server having different culture setting.
member.remarks: See the CultureInfo class for possible names of a culture.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DataGridFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string which determines number formatting in the datagrid.
member.remarks: See 'Formatting Types' in your msdn documentation for a complete list of options. Some shortcuts are also provided for specific settings including "C" or "currency" , "E" or "scientific" , "F" or "fixed" , "G" or "general" and "N,2" for normal and the number after the comma determines the number of decimal places.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DataGridSeriesHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets the header label of the DataGrid control specified by the DataGrid property.
member.remarks: This property controls the header label used for the datagrid series name column. If set to "none" the series name column will be removed. If set to "XAxisLabel", xAxis label set as the header label of the datagrid.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DataGridTranspose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data with which the specified DataGrid control is populated will be transposed.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DateGrouping
member.summary: Gets or sets a dotnetCHARTING.TimeInterval enumeration which determines how the values of a given series are aggregated by date when retrieved from a database.
member.remarks: Controls how the values of a given series are grouped by date. In order to use this option the second column returned by the SqlStatement must be a date/time. Options include Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Months, Quarters and Years where any StartDate and EndDate can be used and the chart will show all values sequentially. There are additional options for Hour/Minute, Day/Hour, Week/Day, Month/Day, Year/Quarter and Year/Month in these cases there are 2 special considerations 1) only a single day / week / month / or year is charted and 2) if the date range is greater than the period type (e.g. 1 day / 1 week / 1 month / 1 year) values are totalled over that period. There are also shortcuts for the grouping cases of Hour (Hours/Minute), Day (Day/Hour), Week(Week/Day), Month (Month/Day) and Year (Year/Month). See all time interval options. This feature automatically groups multiple data points over a given date range into the specific date grouping you select. When DateGrouping is enabled you must ensure that each series within a given chart returns date/time data for the second column returned by the SqlStatement.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DateGroupingCalculation
member.summary: Gets or sets an enum which determines how values are grouped to create a single element value.
member.remarks: When dategrouping is used, if an element has more than one value, a Calculation is performed on those values.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DateGroupingSort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to maintain the sort order of the data as it is provided.
member.remarks: When dategrouping is used and StartDate or EndDate is not set, the data is sorted by the xAxis field by default. Setting this property to true will maintain the sort order of the data as it is provided.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.Debug
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether debug messages are displayed below the chart.
member.remarks: This property controls if error text is returned below the generated image if a problem occurs. This is typically used for debug purposes when initially developing charts. This is provided as a property so that your end users are not exposed to developer level errors. This property defaults to false

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DefaultAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets an dotnetCHARTING.Axis object whose properties will trickle down to all other axes on the chart unless otherwise specified.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DefaultCultureName
member.summary: Gets or sets the default culture name which determines number and date formatting.
member.remarks: Equivalent to Chart.DefaultAxis.CultureName. See the CultureInfo class for possible names of a culture.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DefaultFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the default format string which determines number and date formatting. See Chart.DefaultAxis.FormatString.
member.remarks: Equivalent to Chart.DefaultAxis.FormatString. See 'Formatting Types' in your msdn documentation for a complete list of options. Some shortcuts are also provided for specific settings including "C" or "currency" , "E" or "scientific" , "F" or "fixed" , "G" or "general" and "N,2" for normal and the number after the comma determines the number of decimal places.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DefaultSeries
member.summary: Gets or sets a dotnetCHARTING.Series object whose properties will trickle to all other series on the chart unless otherwise specified.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DefaultShadow
member.summary: Gets or sets a shadow object whose properties will trickle to all other objects with shadows.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.Depth
member.summary: Gets or sets depth of the chart when Use3D is true.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DonutHoleSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a percentage value which determines the relative thickness of the donut ring when ChartType.Donut is used.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.DrillDownChain
member.summary: Gets or sets the drill down chain which activates automatic time based drill down.
member.remarks: When using automated drill down with DateGrouping, this property controls the drill down chain, or hierarchy, that is followed. In addition you can override names to be displayed for the different drill down levels.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.EmptyElementText
member.summary: Gets or sets the default text of empty element labels. See Chart.DefaultSeries.DefaultElement.SmartLabel

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.ErrorMessage
member.summary: See Debug.

member.summary: Gets or sets a Box object that represents the legend box.
member.remarks: Notes - To hide the legend box use Chart.LegendBox.Position = LegendBoxPosition.None. - When Chart.TitleBox.Position = TitleBoxPosition.FullWithLegend is set the legend box will disappear.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.LimitPrimarySeries
member.summary: In a multiple series chart, this property controls the primary series used for the Limit operation. Other series' elements will be matched with the primary series elements and that order will be maintained regardless of the values of the other series. For example, if you limit to the top 5 values and set the LimitPrimarySeries to the sales series other series such as dollar amount or quantity would not affect which elements were ultimately selected for the chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.OverlapFooter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the 'unlicensed chart' footer overlaps the chart or moves it up.
member.remarks: If set to false, the rendered chart will exactly match that of a production licensed chart (which does not have the footer or branding in the top right). If set to true, the chart will be resized slightly so that the footer does not overlap the chart. In all cases the final rendered image will be exactly what you set for Chart.Size or Chart.Height and Chart.Width.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.Use3D
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether chart elements are rendered in 3D.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Chart.UseFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the generated image is saved as a file in the TempDirectory folder or streamed directly to the browser.
member.remarks: .netCHARTING supports streaming images in addition to returning a reference to a generated file. There are differences in the way the control can be used between these two image return methods. When using a file reference, you are free to treat the page as you normally would, including HTML and any other web content on the page. If you are streaming the image back, only the control call should exist on the page because no other HTML will render. This is not a limitation of .netCHARTING but rather specific to the HTTP implementation which serves each request separately (as such a request to a web site with 3 images is actually 4 unique requests and the browser does the job of assembling those 4 items into the web page you see. Becauase streaming images does not allow HTML, setting url and tooltip properties of elements on the chart will have no effect.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartArea.DateGrouping
member.summary: Gets or sets a dotnetCHARTING.TimeInterval enumeration which determines how the values of a given series are aggregated by date when retrieved from a database.
member.remarks: Controls how the values of a given series are grouped by date. In order to use this option the second column returned by the SqlStatement must be a date/time. Options include Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Months, Quarters and Years where any StartDate and EndDate can be used and the chart will show all values sequentially. There are additional options for Hour/Minute, Day/Hour, Week/Day, Month/Day, Year/Quarter and Year/Month in these cases there are 2 special considerations 1) only a single day / week / month / or year is charted and 2) if the date range is greater than the period type (e.g. 1 day / 1 week / 1 month / 1 year) values are totalled over that period. There are also shortcuts for the grouping cases of Hour (Hours/Minute), Day (Day/Hour), Week(Week/Day), Month (Month/Day) and Year (Year/Month). See all time interval options. This feature automatically groups multiple data points over a given date range into the specific date grouping you select. When DateGrouping is enabled you must ensure that each series within a given chart returns date/time data for the second column returned by the SqlStatement.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartArea.DateGroupingCalculation
member.summary: Gets or sets an enum which determines how values are grouped to create a single element value.
member.remarks: When dategrouping is used, if an element has more than one value, a Calculation is performed on those values.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.ChartArea.DateGroupingSort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to maintain the sort order of the data as it is provided.
member.remarks: When dategrouping is used and StartDate or EndDate is not set, the data is sorted by the xAxis field by default. Setting this property to true will maintain the sort order of the data as it is provided.

member.summary: Initiates data acquisition and processing based on the specified data engine settings.
member.remarks: When ChartType is set to Financial and DateGrouping is specified, high, low, open, and close element values will be calculated based on the price field. Otherwise they will not be generated.
member.returns: A SeriesCollection containting the resulting chart data.

member.summary: Gets or sets the wait time before terminating the attempt to execute a command and generating an error.
member.remarks: The time (in seconds) to wait for the command to execute. The default value is 30 seconds.

member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to open a SQL Server, Access, or Excel database.
member.remarks: Access, Excel and SQL server are supported and automatically detected based on the connection string specified. See Getting Started > Tutorials > Connecting to data.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.CultureName
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture name used when element names are populated with values such as dates.
member.remarks: See the CultureInfo class for possible names of a culture.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets a DataTable, DataSet, DataView, XML file name, Xml string or an object that implement IEnumerable, ArrayList or HashTable used to generate a SeriesCollection.
member.remarks: When not connecting to a database directly using ConnectionString and SqlStatement, this property offers an alternative method for obtaining database data.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DatabaseCultureName
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture name used when StartDate and EndDate insert to the sql statement. This property only necessary to set if the web server and database server having different culture setting.
member.remarks: See the CultureInfo class for possible names of a culture.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DataFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the 'database column' to 'element value' relationship.
member.remarks: See Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Fields for more info.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DataGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets the control object of a datagrid control that will be populated with the charted data.
member.remarks: This property accepts a datagrid control object. If set, the data represented in the chart is populated in the datagrid of the same name. You must also define a datagrid control within the same script. This property is useful when displaying tabular chart data along with your charts.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DataGridFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string which determines number formatting in the datagrid.
member.remarks: See 'Formatting Types' in your msdn documentation for a complete list of options. Some shortcuts are also provided for specific settings including "C" or "currency" , "E" or "scientific" , "F" or "fixed" , "G" or "general" and "N,2" for normal and the number after the comma determines the number of decimal places.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DataGridSeriesHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets the header label of the DataGrid control specified by the DataGrid property.
member.remarks: This property controls the header label used for the datagrid series name column. If set to "none" the series name column will be removed. If set to "XAxisLabel", xAxis label set as the header label of the datagrid.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DataGridTranspose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data with which the specified DataGrid control is populated will be transposed.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DateGrouping
member.summary: Gets or sets the date grouping of data returned from your database.
member.remarks: Controls how the values of a given series are grouped by date. In order to use this option the first column returned by the SqlStatement must be a date/time. Options include Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Months, Quarters and Years where any StartDate and EndDate can be used and the chart will show all values sequentially. There are additional options for Hour/Minute, Day/Hour, Week/Day, Month/Day, Year/Quarter and Year/Month in these cases there are 2 special considerations 1) only a single day / week / month / or year is charted and 2) if the date range is greater than the period type (e.g. 1 day / 1 week / 1 month / 1 year) values are totalled over that period. There are also shortcuts for the grouping cases of Hour (Hours/Minute), Day (Day/Hour), Week(Week/Day), Month (Month/Day) and Year (Year/Month). See all time interval options. This feature automatically groups multiple data points over a given date range into the specific date grouping you select. When DateGrouping is enabled you must ensure that each series within a given chart returns date/time data for the first column returned by the SqlStatement. Controls how the values of a given series are grouped by date. In order to use this option the first column returned by the SqlStatement must be a date/time. Options include Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Months, Quarters and Years where any StartDate and EndDate can be used and the chart will show all values sequentially. There are additional options for Hour/Minute, Day/Hour, Week/Day, Month/Day, Year/Quarter and Year/Month in these cases there are 2 special considerations 1) only a single day / week / month / or year is charted and 2) if the date range is greater than the period type (e.g. 1 day / 1 week / 1 month / 1 year) values are totalled over that period. There are also shortcuts for the grouping cases of Hour (Hours/Minute), Day (Day/Hour), Week(Week/Day), Month (Month/Day) and Year (Year/Month). See all time interval options. This feature automatically groups multiple data points over a given date range into the specific date grouping you select. When DateGrouping is enabled you must ensure that each series within a given chart returns date/time data for the first column returned by the SqlStatement. See Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DateGroupingCalculation
member.summary: Gets or sets an enum which determines how values are grouped to create a single element value.
member.remarks: When dategrouping is used, if an element has more than one value, a Calculation is performed on those values.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DateGroupingSort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to maintain the sort order of the data as it is provided.
member.remarks: When dategrouping is used and StartDate or EndDate is not set, the data is sorted by the xAxis field by default. Setting this property to true will maintain the sort order of the data as it is provided.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.DrillDownIntoSeries
member.summary: When using automated drill down in conjunction with date grouping and multiple series, this property determines if drill down will occur into a single series or multiple series.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.EndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the ending date used with SqlStatement to query filtered data from a database.
member.remarks: This property is used for the SqlStatement property where the #EndDate# token is replaced with the value set to this property. See: Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets an error message which will be available if this DataEngine instance fails after a call to GetSeries().

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.FormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string used when element names are populated with values such as dates.
member.remarks: This property usually used with conjunction of date grouping. If it doesn't set, use an appropriate format for the date grouping. For format information see DateTimeFormatInfo or NumberFormatInfo

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.Limit
member.summary: Gets or sets the limit number of elements returned for each series when data is generated. Gets or sets the limit number of elements returned for each series when data is generated. This property determines the number of elements to include in the limited return. The limit string can be a number "3" or "2x3". In the second format, the first number determines the group position and the second number is the limit. By setting "2x3" with top limit mode, it only return the second "3" maximum elements.
member.remarks: If DateGrouping is used, limit has no effect. In such a case, StartDate and EndDate must be used to limit the generated element count. See Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.LimitMode
member.summary: Determine the type of limitation. Default is Top.
member.remarks: This property works in conjunction with Limit or SplitByLimit to determine which elements or series should be included or excluded.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.LimitPrimarySeries
member.summary: In a multiple series chart, this property controls the primary series used for the Limit operation. Other series' elements will be matched with the primary series elements and that order will be maintained regardless of the values of the other series. For example, if you limit to the top 5 values and set the LimitPrimarySeries to the sales series other series such as dollar amount or quantity would not affect which elements were ultimately selected for the chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.OtherElementLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets the label used for the element or series created when using Limit or SplitByLimit and setting ShowOther to true.
member.remarks: See Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine for more info.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.ParameterCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of Parameter objects used in conjunction with the StoredProcedure property.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.PopulateDateGroupingSubValues
member.summary: When using date grouping the main value in the element is derived from the actual values in the database or data provided to .netCHARTING. This property controls whether these subvalues used in the calculation to determine the element value are added to SubValues or not. By default, such values are not added to the element subvalues.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.ShowOther
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the additional series not shown due to the use of SplitByLimit, or elements not shown due to the use of Limit, are aggregated into a single series or element.
member.remarks: See Gettings Started > Tutorials > Data Engine for more info. The default is false.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.SplitByLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of series created using SplitBy.
member.remarks: This property works with conjunction of LimitMode property and determines the number of series to include in the return. The limit string can be a number "3" or "2x3". In the second format, the first number determines the group positon and the second number is the limit. By setting "2x3" with top limit mode, it only return the second "3" maximum series. See Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.SqlStatement
member.summary: The SQL statement used to obtain the charting data.
member.remarks: The first column returned is used for the X values, and the second for the Y values. The first also has special handling if dates are returned as the DateGrouping property can be used for intelligent date handling and grouping. The third column is optional and is used only for SplitBy. When a third column is set it is used automatically to create a unique series based on each unique value in this column. NOTE: All date values in your SQL statements should be wrapped with the pound symbol: #10/25/2002#, regardless if Access or SQL server is used. Also the #StartDate# and #EndDate# tokens can be used in which case the dates set for these properties will be set in place of the tokens before the SqlStatement is executed. See Getting Started > Tutorials > Queries for more info.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.StartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting date used with SqlStatement to query filtered data from a database.
member.remarks: This property is used for the SqlStatement property where the #StartDate# token is replaced with the value set to this property. See: Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.StartDateOfYear
member.summary: Gets or sets a DateTime object to determine the start month of the year when DateGrouping is used.
member.remarks: This property determine the start month of the year. The default is January.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.StartDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets a DayOfWeek enumeration that determines the day which will be used as the starting day of the week for the dategrouping functionality.
member.remarks: This property used with conjunction of date grouping by weeks. The default is Sunday.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.DataEngine.StoredProcedure
member.summary: This property accepts the name of a stored procedure to be used in place of the SqlStatement property in order to obtain data for the chart.
member.remarks: Stored Procedures also work with parameters, see the FieldType) method. See Getting Started > Tutorials > Connecting to Data for more info.

member.remarks: All other string features such as expressions and embedded formatting are supported by this method.

Chart type used with this DataSource.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element
member.summary: Represents a element object or data point on the chart.
member.remarks: The Element object contains properties that describe it's value such as YValue, YDateTime, BubbleSize etc.. It also defines defines objects and properties that specify the element's behavior and appearance. Element properties that don't describe it's value can be set simultaneously for all element in a Series by setting them with Series.DefaultElement.___ For example:(Chart.DefaultSeries.DefaultElement.SmartLabel.Text = "YValue"). See also20Model.html">Data Model Tutorial

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Annotation
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's dotnetCHARTING.Annotation.
member.remarks: The annotation's position will be the same as this element's position, usless specified. Element tokens can be used by this annotation's text to describe the element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.AxisMarker
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's dotnetCHARTING.AxisMarker.
member.remarks: This axis marker will highlight a section of the axis on which this element's name appears.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.BubbleSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the bubble size of this element.
member.remarks: This Element value type is used by ChartType.Bubble only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Close
member.summary: Gets or sets the financial closing price of this element.
member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's color.
member.remarks: This color will also trickle to this element's SmartLabel.Color property, unless specified. When this element instance is the Series.DefaultElement of a Series, this color will trickle to that series' Line.Color property, unless specified.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Complete
member.summary: Gets or sets the percent complete value of this element.
member.remarks: This Element value type is used by ChartType.Combo, ComboHorizontal, and ComboSideBySide with Column and Cylinder SeriesType. Primarily used to create Gantt charts.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.CustomAttributes
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom attributes associated with this element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.DefaultSubValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a default dotnetCHARTING.SubValue object used to propagate its property settings to all SubValue objects in the SubValues collection.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ErrorHighValue
member.summary: Gets of sets the high error value. When set, a single SubValue is drawn above the element's value. When ErrorLowValue is also set, a range SubValue is drawn between the two values.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ErrorLowValue
member.summary: Gets of sets the low error value. When set, a single SubValue is drawn below the element's YValue value or range. When ErrorHighValue is also set, a range SubValue is drawn between the two values.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ErrorMinusOffset
member.summary: Gets of sets the negative error offset. When set, a single SubValue is drawn below the element's value.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ErrorMinusPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the negative error offset based on the specified percentage of the element's YValue value or range. When set, a single SubValue is drawn below the element's value. When ErrorPlusPercent is also set, a range SubValue is drawn between the two points.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ErrorOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the error offset. The offset represents a range, +/- the value of the offset with respect to the element's YValue value or range.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ErrorPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the error offset based on the specified percentage of the element's YValue value or range. The offset represents a range, +/- the percentage of the element's YValue value or range.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ErrorPlusOffset
member.summary: Gets of sets the positive error offset. When set, a single SubValue is drawn above the element's value.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ErrorPlusPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the positive error offset based on the specified percentage of the element's YValue value or range. When set, a single SubValue is drawn above the element's value. When ErrorMinusPercent is also set, a range SubValue is drawn between the two points.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ExplodePieSlice
member.summary: See ExplodeSlice

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ExplodeSlice
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the pie slice represented by this element is exploded.
member.remarks: When a pie slice represents a series, that series' DefaultElement.ExplodeSlice property indicates whether the slice is exploded.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ForceMarker
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this element's ElementMarker is drawn when the parent Series object's SeriesType omits the ElementMarker by default.
member.remarks: Only SeriesTypes: Line (when Use3D = false), Spline, and Marker draw ElementMarkers by default.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.HatchColor
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's HatchStyle color.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.HatchStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's hatch style.
member.remarks: Hatch styles are filled using HatchColor. By default the color is transparent and may need to be specified before the hatch appears.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which represents the height of pie slices.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.High
member.summary: Gets or sets the financial high price of this element.
member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Hotspot
member.summary: Gets or sets the Hotspot of this Element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.LabelTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's SmartLabel.Text property.
member.remarks: Element tokens can be used to describe this element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.LegendEntry
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's dotnetCHARTING.LegendEntry.
member.remarks: The legend entry represents this element in the LegendBox. Most charts types will only show legend entries of series, not individual elements. Changing this behavior to show the element's legend entries is done by setting the series' Palette or PaletteName properties.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets a percent value representing this element's needle length. Also used to represent pie slice length.
member.remarks: Applies to gauge charts.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Low
member.summary: Gets or sets the financial low price of this element.
member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Marker
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's Marker.
member.remarks: Only SeriesType options: Line (when Use3D = false), Spline, and Marker draw ElementMarkers by default. For other SeriesTypes, ForceMarker must be true.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's name.
member.remarks: The name property represents the element on label axes.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Open
member.summary: Gets or sets the financial open price of this element.
member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Outline
member.summary: Gets or sets a Line object used to an outline around this element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Point
member.summary: Gets the element's pixel coordinate on a chart image.
member.remarks: This position is only available after the chart is rendered.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.SecondaryColor
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's secondary color.
member.remarks: The secondary color is used with financial series types to indicate that the closing price (dotnetCHARTING.Element.Close) is lower than the opening price (dotnetCHARTING.Element.Open).

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ShowValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether this element's SmartLabel is visible.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.SmartLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's dotnetCHARTING.SmartLabel.
member.remarks: By default this label is hidden unless ShowValue is true.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.SubValues
member.summary: Gets a collection of SubValue objects drawn on this Element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.TakeColorFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets a Series or Element object from which this element's color will be inherited.
member.remarks: The specified object must be one that is used and in the chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.ToolTip
member.summary: Gets or sets this elements tool tip. (Shortcut to: Element.Hotspot.Tooltip)
member.remarks: Element tokens can be used to describe this element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Transparency
member.summary: Gets or sets the element color's transparency.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will have no transparency and 100 will be completely transparent.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.URL
member.summary: Gets or sets the element's URL link. (Shortcut to: Element.Hotspot.URL)
member.remarks: The chart will create an image map with the specified url for this element. Element tokens can be used to describe this element in the url.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets the financial volume of this element.
member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.XAxisTick
member.summary: Gets or sets an AxisTick object that will placed on the x axis at the position of this element's x value. If the x axis is a category axis, AxisTick will not have any effect.
member.remarks: This value is null by default.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.XDateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the X DateTime value of this element.
member.remarks: This Element value is used with value x axes.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.XDateTimeStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial X DateTime value of this element.
member.remarks: Not yet implemented.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.XValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the X value of this element.
member.remarks: This Element value is used with value x axes.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.XValueStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial X value of this element.
member.remarks: Not yet implemented.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.YAxisTick
member.summary: Gets or sets an AxisTick object that will placed on the y axis at the position of this element's y value. If the x axis is a category axis, AxisTick will not have any effect.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.YDateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y DateTime value of this element.
member.remarks: Using ChartType.ComboHorizontal the YDateTime value type corresponds to the x axis because this allows the element to be interchangeable between the vertical and horizontal combo chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.YDateTimeStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial Y DateTime value of this element.
member.remarks: Using ChartType.ComboHorizontal the YDateTimeStart value type corresponds to the x axis because this allows the element to be interchangeable between the vertical and horizontal combo chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.YValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the y value of this element.
member.remarks: YValue is the main value container for elements. It is used at times when the element's value would not officially be considered the y value such as: pie slice value. Using ChartType.ComboHorizontal the YValue type value corresponds to the x axis because this allows the element to be interchangable between the vertical and horizontal combo chart. This Element value type is used by all chart types except ChartType.Financial.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.Element.YValueStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial Y value of this element.
member.remarks: Using ChartType.ComboHorizontal, the YValueStart type value corresponds to the x axis because this allows the element to be interchangable between the vertical and horizontal combo chart. This Element value type is used by all chart types except ChartType.Financial.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.FileManager.CachePeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets a TimeSpan object that determines the amount of time an image is cached and displayed on a page before a new one is generated.
member.remarks: When set, a given chart image will be generated on the first hit and on all subsequent hits within the cache duration period, the same image will be returned with no rendering work by the chart control.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.FileManager.CleanupMinimumAge
member.summary: Gets or sets a TimeSpan object that determines the minimum amount of time images are stored in the TempDirectory folder before they are deleted.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.FileManager.CleanupPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets a TimeSpan object that determines the amount of time the TempDirectory folder would be checked for deleting old image files.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.WinForms.FileManager.FileName
member.summary: Sets the file name to save an image as, or gets the file name of an image that has been saved in the TempDirectory after a chart is generated.
member.remarks: When empty, a random name will be created. In order for the cleanup system to include custom file names they must start with 'dnc-', the mask is: 'dnc-*.*'.
